title: Four Seasons sells half its estate as it gears up for battle with landlords
text:
The bulk of Four Seasons’ care home sites have been snapped up by an American hedge fund in a £350m deal, as it braces for crunch talks with landlords over rents on the rest of its estate.

Britain’s second-largest care-home operator has sold its entire freehold estate, making up over half its 322 hospitals and homes, along with some of its leasehold sites to Connecticut-based H/2 Capital Partners, its biggest creditor.

The deal gives Four Seasons room to breath as it begins bargaining with landlords. The company was accused of playing “Russian roulette” with the future of thousands of vulnerable residents last week after it began withholding payments as part of hardball rent negotiations.
